channel.title: Bloomberg Markets
channel.copyright: Copyright 2025 BLOOMBERG L.P. ALL RIGHTS RESERVED

item.title: Mnuchin Expects Tax Bill to Pass by Early Summer
item.description: Former US Treasury Secretary Steven Mnuchin, now founder and managing partner at Liberty Strategic Capital, says that while there are still a few things to sort out on the tax bill, the Trump administration is on track to get it through by early summer. He made the comments during a panel discussion moderated by Erik Schatzker at the Qatar Economic Forum 2025, powered by Bloomberg. (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Zimbabwe Lithium Exporters Seek Tax Delay
item.description: Miners in Zimbabwe are urging the government to defer an export tax on lithium concentrate until plants that will refine the battery material into higher-value products in the country come online.
item.dc:creator: Godfrey Marawanyika

media:content.media:description: Mining operations at the Bikita Minerals operated by Sinomine Resource Group Co., in Bikita, Zimbabwe.

item.title: Hedge Fund Founder’s German Tax Fraud Money Laundering Charges Dropped
item.description: German money laundering charges against hedge fund founder Sanjay Shah in a €330 million ($374 million) case were dropped after his conviction in a similar Danish prosecution.
item.dc:creator: Karin Matussek

item.title: SALT Fight Unresolved as Self-Imposed Deadline Nears
item.description: House lawmakers debated through the night on the contours of President Donald Trump’s tax cuts despite unresolved policy disputes that threaten to tank the bill, including a fight over expanding the state and local tax deduction, and curbing spending on Medicaid benefits. Annmarie Hordern reports on Bloomberg Television.

item.title: India’s Short-Term Bonds Rally on Hopes of Record RBI Dividend
item.description: Shorter-tenor Indian bonds are leading a rally, with the government borrowing costs dropping to a three-year low at a bill auction on expectations of a bumper dividend payout from the central bank later this week.
item.dc:creator: Subhadip Sircar

media:content.media:description: The Reserve Bank of India in Mumbai.

item.title: Stocks Fall With Dollar as Traders Turn Cautious: Markets Wrap
item.description: US stocks are set to extend a retreat with traders nervous about taking on more risk as House lawmakers debate tax cuts at the center of the Trump administration’s policy agenda. Treasuries and the dollar also fell.
item.dc:creator: Andre Janse Van Vuuren, Lynn Thomasson

item.title: Traders on Watch for a Banff Accord That Sinks Dollar Further
item.description: G-7 finance ministers are meeting in Canada
item.dc:creator: Simon Kennedy, Phil Serafino

item.title: Russia’s Top Oil Producer Buys Giant Siberian Rare-Earth Deposit
item.description: Russia’s largest oil producer bought a giant Siberian rare-earth deposit, which may become an area of cooperation with the US.
item.dc:creator: James Herron

item.title: Nvidia CEO Huang Urges US to Ease AI Chip Restrictions
item.description: Nvidia Corp. chief Jensen Huang criticized the “failure” of US restrictions intended to help contain China’s technological ascent, calling on the White House to lower barriers to AI chip sales. Charlie Wells reports on Bloomberg Television.

item.title: BOJ Hearings Underscore Divergent Opinions on Bond Tapering Pace
item.description: The Bank of Japan heard mixed views from market participants over two days on how quickly it should taper its bond buying, input that will help guide its quantitative tightening plans as signs of strain build in the bond market.
item.dc:creator: Yoshiaki Nohara

media:content.media:description: The Bank of Japan headquarters in Tokyo. Photographer: Toru Hanai/Bloomberg

item.title: Hengrui Pharma Prices at Top End for $1.3 Billion Hong Kong Listing
item.description: Jiangsu Hengrui Pharmaceuticals Co. priced its Hong Kong stock offering at the top of the marketed range to raise HK$9.9 billion ($1.3 billion).
item.dc:creator: Dave Sebastian

item.title: Macroeconomic Moves: What Top Investors See Ahead
item.description: Katie Koch, President & CEO, The TCW Group and Rajeev Misra, Founder, One Investment Managemen discuss navigating global macroeconomic shifts and what lies ahead for investors with Bloomberg’s Joumanna Bercetche at the 2025 Qatar Economic Forum, Powered by Bloomberg. (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: UK, EU Extend Debt Sale Timings Due to Bloomberg Tech Issues
item.description: The UK and European Union extended the bidding window for debt auctions on Wednesday in response to Bloomberg LP technical issues.
item.dc:creator: Greg Ritchie

media:content.media:description: HM Treasury in Westminster, London. Photographer: Hollie Adams/Bloomberg

item.title: Oil Climbs on Report That Israel Is Preparing to Strike Iran
item.description: Oil rallied following a CNN report that new US intelligence suggests Israel is preparing for a potential strike on Iranian nuclear facilities.
item.dc:creator: Yongchang Chin, Rob Verdonck

media:content.media:description: The Bushehr nuclear power plant in Bushehr province, Iran. Source: NurPhoto/NurPhoto

item.title: Musk Distorts the State of Market Where Tesla Sales Have Crashed
item.description: Elon Musk mischaracterized the state of Europe’s auto market this year when he said Tesla Inc. is seeing sales decline along with every other carmaker.
item.dc:creator: Craig Trudell, Anthony Palazzo

media:content.media:description: Elon Musk speaks via video link at the Qatar Economic Forum (QEF) in Doha, Qatar, on May 20.

item.title: Eric Trump Attends Groundbreaking Event for $1.5 Billion Vietnam Resort
item.description: Eric Trump said the Trump Organization’s new $1.5 billion luxury resort complex to be built in northern Vietnam will “blow everybody away,” even as the nation’s leaders negotiate with the US administration to avoid a cripplingly high tariff.
item.dc:creator: Giang Nguyen, Nguyen Xuan Quynh

item.title: Trump Jr. Hints at Future Presidential Run
item.description: Omeed Malik, President, 1789 Capital and Donald Trump Jr., Executive Vice President of Development & Acquisitions, The Trump Organization & Partner, 1798 Capital discuss politics and global investing with Bloomberg’s Joumanna Bercetche at the 2025 Qatar Economic Forum, Powered by Bloomberg. (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: China’s LNG Traders Embrace New Role as Global Swing Suppliers
item.description: Chinese gas firms are taking advantage of diverse supply sources and a flexible power generation system to lean into the role of global swing suppliers.
item.dc:creator: Dan Murtaugh, Kathy Chen

item.title: KIA, Oaktree Capital on The Global Investor Outlook
item.description: H.E. Sheikh Saoud Salem Abdulaziz Al-Sabah, Managing Director, Kuwait Investment Authority and Howard Marks, Co-Chairman, Oaktree Capital Management share insights on the global investor outlook amid shifting economic conditions with Bloomberg’s Stephanie Flanders at the 2025 Qatar Economic Forum, Powered by Bloomberg. (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Private Equity Is Troubled, $1 Trillion Kuwait Fund’s Boss Warns
item.description: The head of one of the world’s largest sovereign wealth funds said the clock is ticking for private equity and joined the chorus of investors who’ve grown worried about the industry’s valuation practices.
item.dc:creator: Dinesh Nair, Matthew Martin, Fiona MacDonald

media:content.media:description: Sheikh Saoud Salem Abdulaziz Al-Sabah on May 21. Photographer: Christopher Pike/Bloomberg

item.title: US Stocks Need Earnings Boost to Regain Edge Over Global Peers
item.description: Six weeks into a torrid rebound, US stocks are still laggards in global equity markets this year. For them to sustain the rally and reclaim their usual spot at the top of the pack, Corporate America’s profit engine needs to rev back up, analysts at Bloomberg Intelligence say.
item.dc:creator: Alexandra Semenova

item.title: Trump Organization Not Doing Deals With Govt. Entities: Donald Trump Jr.
item.description: Donald Trump Jr. says the Trump Organization won't be doing any business with government entities while his father holds the office of US President, rejecting the idea of a conflict of interest. "We're going to play by the rules," he says during a panel discussion moderated by Joumanna Bercetche at the Qatar Economic Forum 2025, powered by Bloomberg. (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Merz Advisers See Germany in Stagnation But Recovery in Sight
item.description: Germany’s economy will stagnate this year, though a recovery is in sight thanks to plans to ramp up government spending, Chancellor Friedrich Merz’s independent panel of experts said.
item.dc:creator: Mark Schroers

item.title: ECB Warns of Ripple Effects From Investors Questioning US Assets
item.description: The European Central Bank warned that heightened investor concern over the riskiness of US assets following Donald Trump’s tariff drive could further jolt the world’s financial system.
item.dc:creator: Alexander Weber, Mark Schroers

media:content.media:description: The European Central Bank headquarters in Frankfurt, Germany, on Friday, May 9, 2025. In March, the ECB projected 0.9% growth this year, followed by 1.2% and 1.3% in 2026 and 2027.

item.title: Dubai Ruler’s Firm Gets $15 Billion in Orders for REIT Listing
item.description: Dubai Holding attracted $15 billion in orders for the $584 million initial public offering of its residential real estate investment trust, the latest sign of investor interest in the city’s booming property market.
item.dc:creator: Laura Gardner Cuesta

media:content.media:description: Commercial and residential properties in Dubai.

item.title: ECB Will Soon Reach Terminal Rate If Baseline Holds, Kazaks Says
item.description: European Central Bank Governing Council member Martins Kazaks said interest-rate cuts are nearing an end, assuming the base case for inflation stabilizing at 2% over the coming months comes to pass.
item.dc:creator: Aaron Eglitis

item.title: FTSE 100 Live: Pound Touches 2022 Highs After Hotter UK Inflation
Claure, Lee & Mnuchin on Growth in a Complex Economy
item.description: Marcelo Claure, Co-Chairman & Partner, Brightstar Capital Partners & CEO & Founder, Claure Group; Jenny Lee, Senior Managing Partner, Granite Asia; and Steven T. Mnuchin, Founder & Managing Partner, Liberty Strategic Capital & Former Secretary, US Department of the Treasury discuss strategies for pursuing growth in a complex global economy with Bloomberg's Erik Schatzker at the 2025 Qatar Economic Forum, Powered by Bloomberg. (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: World Crazy for Chicken Is Suddenly Losing Its Biggest Supplier
item.description: The detection of bird flu in a single poultry farm in southern Brazil is reverberating around the world, depriving buyers from China to Europe of the chicken they’re increasingly voracious to consume.
item.dc:creator: Clarice Couto, Gerson Freitas Jr

media:content.media:description: A commercial poultry farm, site of Brazil's first bird flu outbreak, in Montenegro, Rio Grande do Sul state, Brazil.

item.title: Dollar Extends Slide With G-7 Meeting, Budget Deficit in Focus
item.description: A gauge of the dollar fell to a two-week low as traders awaited a Group-of-Seven meeting this week for any signs the Trump administration is seeking a weaker US dollar.
item.dc:creator: David Finnerty, Vassilis Karamanis
